speaker: Ossuary
lines: You enter an ossuary where bones are stacked and sorted.
Empty sockets look past you from the walls.
Rosary beads tie to a pillar near the steps.
A femur holds a candle; wax has pooled and cooled.
Your boot knocks a tibia and you set it back in place.
Some skulls are missing teeth; some are not.
A new ribbon loops a vertebra and trails dust.
You are not the first to seek the quiet here.

choices.text: Whisper a litany and move on.
Pocket the ribbon and follow a fresh footprint.
Sit and let your bones rest with their cousins.
